recipes.name: Spanish Sausage Stew
method: Slice sausages into bite size pieces and lightly fry in oil until browning.
Add onion or leek to pan with pinch of salt and cook until softened.
Add red pepper, cook until onions or leeks have browned
Add sweet potato or carrot, paprika and herbs. Stir and add tomatoes.
Top up with water or veg stock, and allow to simmer until veg is softened.
Taste and add salt, pepper and lemon juice to taste. Add greens and simmer for a further few minutes.

recipes.name: Tofu Tikka Masala
ingredients: 1 block extra firm tofu, pressed and cubed
Curry powder (parts: 1 cumin, 1 ground coriander, 1 turmeric, 1 paprika, 0.25 hot chilli powder, 0.25 fennel, 0.25 cinnamon, 0.25 cardamom, 0.25 black pepper)
method: Coat tofu in oil and curry powder, place on baking tray.
Hack up peppers and place on baking tray, with tofu and tomato. Allow to roast.
When tofu is nearly golden and vegetables are nearly cooked, fry onion in oil for at least 10 minutes with salt.
Add garlic and ginger paste, coriander stalks, and 2 heaped tablespoons of curry powder. Cook for a few minutes.
Add onion-spice mixture to a blender along with roasted vegetables, tomato puree and stock to loosen. Blend until smooth
Return to pan, simmer and add the cream of the coconut milk. Add the coconut water or more stock until smooth and creamy.
Stir in tofu and fresh chopped coriander. Season with salt, a pinch of sugar and lemon/lime juice to taste. Serve with pilau rice and naan.
